page.title: 10A Talk with an Old Person
page.content: One of the ladies that we interviewed had lived in Desborough for{80 years she gave us this information about Desborough. The school she went to was Desborough county school for girls, which is now called{Havelock Junior School}and it is now a mixed school. There was no A6 in Desborough. There was a Blacksmith's shop in those days and the children all used to watch the smith work. The largest residential road in Desborough is{Dunkirk avenue,} which did not exist then. Then it was covered by many allotments. The houses did not have any bathrooms then but many have been rebuilt . The present day Gold Sreet was then a yard and the poor houses were there.All the children who lived there caught a disease from washing in the water from the taps outside.
